exploration_path.sentence_content: I wanted to focus on mobility and accessibility, so I started by looking at London boroughs with the best transport links to central areas.
exploration_path.system_shows: Bar chart: average commute time to Zone 1 by borough; heatmap overlay showing tube/rail station density

exploration_path.sentence_content: Greenwich, Lewisham, and Tower Hamlets showed strong connectivity, but I wanted to understand the cost side of this mobility advantage.
exploration_path.system_shows: Transport cost calculator by borough; monthly zone pass pricing; commute cost vs salary percentage

exploration_path.sentence_content: When I factored in transport costs alongside housing costs, the total affordability picture shifted significantly for each area.
exploration_path.system_shows: Stacked bar chart: housing cost + transport cost by borough; total monthly burden visualization

exploration_path.sentence_content: I then looked at local amenities within walking distance to see which areas offered the best daily convenience without transport dependence.
exploration_path.system_shows: Walkability score by borough; density of shops, cafes, and services within 800m radius

exploration_path.sentence_content: The data revealed that some well-connected areas had poor local amenities, making residents more dependent on travel for daily needs.
exploration_path.system_shows: Scatter plot: transport connectivity vs local amenity score; quadrant analysis highlighting different lifestyle trade-offs

data_story.data_story_sentence: Transport connectivity analysis identified Greenwich, Lewisham, and Tower Hamlets as having superior access to central London.
However, when transport costs were included in affordability calculations, the true cost of mobility became apparent.
Combined housing and transport costs revealed a more nuanced affordability landscape across London boroughs.
Local walkability analysis showed that high connectivity areas often compensate for lower neighborhood amenity density.
The final analysis revealed trade-offs between transport connectivity and local self-sufficiency across different boroughs.
